gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਸੁਖ ਚਾਹਤ ਸਕਲ ਪੰਥ ਸਕਲ ਦਰਸ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸ ਅਧੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Pand Soukh Chaahat Sakal Panda , Sakal Daras Gur Daras Adheen Hai ?
translation: All religions yearn for the comfort and peace of the path of Guru-conscious people. All cults and religions are subservient and in attendance to the path of Guru

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰ ਸੁਰਸਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨ ਚਾਹੈ ਬੇਦ ਬ੍ਹਮਾਦਿਕ ਸਬਦ ਲਿਵ ਲੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sur Surasari Gur Charan Saran Chaahai , Bayd Brahamaadik Sabad Liv Leen Hai ?
translation: All gods and their holy rivers yearn for the refuge of Satguru Ji. Brahma the creator of Vedas also longs to attach his mind in the words of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਰਬ ਗਿਅਾਨਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਅਵਗਾਹਨ ਮੈ ਸਰਬ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਗੁਰ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਜਲ ਮੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sarab Giaani Guru Giaan Avagaahan Mai , Sarab Nidhaan Gur Kripaa Jal Meen Hai ?
translation: All the religions are seekers of the Naam Simran. By the blessings of the Guru, one gets all the treasures of the world just as a fish receives life-supporting water.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗੀ ਜੋਗ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਮੈ ਭੋਗੀ ਭੋਗ ਭੁਗਤਿ ਮੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਿਜ ਪਦ ਕੁਲ ਅਕੁਲੀਨ ਹੈ ||੫੮||
transliteration: Jogee Jog Jougati Mai Bhogee Bhog Bhougati Mai , Gurmukhi Nij Pad Kul Akuleen Hai ?58?
translation: Just as the Yogis are perpetually immersed in practicing yogic exercises and a worldly man is ever engrossed in enjoying the relishments, similarly the devoted Sikhs remain engrossed in the higher spiritual state through Naam Simran and keep themselves un
